data.title: How to watch Lifetime’s new thriller ‘Sister Wife Murder,’ inspired by real events, for free
data.meta_description: One woman’s relationship with her polygamist pastor becomes a life threatening marriage in Lifetime’s new thriller based on a true story.
data.text:
One woman’s relationship with her polygamist pastor becomes a life threatening marriage in Lifetime’s new thriller based on a true story, “Sister Wife Murder.” Watch the movie when it airs Saturday, July 13, at 8 p.m. ET on Lifetime.

Stream it for free with a trial from Philo or DIRECTV Stream, or find it on Sling.

About the show:

“Sister Wife Murder” follows Chloe, who becomes enamored with her pastor Caleb after attending church for the first time. In between secret moments and stolen glances, she falls in love with him only to learn that he’s already married – to two wives. Despite their unorthodox situation, Chloe is overjoyed when he proposes. But after experiencing Caleb’s controlling behavior, she quickly realizes that their love was a far cry from happily-ever-after. Chloe and the other wives, Anna and Margo, only have each other to depend on. When one of them mysteriously disappears, Chloe fears she may be next.

Watch “Sister Wife Murder” tonight, July 13, at 8/7c on Lifetime.

Where to watch Lifetime:

Philo (start free trial) - For $28/month, ditch cable and unlock 70+ channels of reality TV, movies, and more, live and on-demand. Click here to watch.

DIRECTV Stream (try it free) - With plans starting at $79.99/month, switch toDIRECTV Stream to enjoy 75+ channels and numerousadd-ons. And, as a limited-time offer, get both the Entertainment and Sports packs for $84.98/month for three months. Click here to explore more DIRECTV options.

Sling (try today) - Save on Sling for a limited-time. For the first month, plans start at $25 off — that’s $15 for Sling Orange or Sling Blue, and $30 for both Orange + Blue (followed by $40/month and $55/month, respectively). Register and stream 30+ channels including sports, History, DVR storage, add-on packages and more.
